title: The Queen sends fans into meltdown as she sports pockets on a frock
text:
A newly released portrait of the Queen has sent royal fans into meltdown over the monarch's sense of style.

The undated photograph was published by Hello! magazine today to mark the publication of her dressmaker Angela Kelly’s book The Other Side of the Coin: The Queen, the Dresser and the Wardrobe.

It shows the smiling monarch, 93, standing with her hands firmly in her pockets of her cream textured dress.

Social media users were keen to compliment the Queen on her 'red carpet worthy pose' and were thrilled to see her adopt pockets in her ensemble.

Royal enthusiasts have once again praised the Queen for her sense of style after she sported a glamorous frock with pockets in a stunning portrait (pictured)

One person wrote: 'I had to give this a double take. The glory of pockets, now given the Royal seal.'

Another said: 'One of my favourite pictures of Her Majesty... every girl loves a pocket,' as a third added: 'Beautiful picture... good to see Her Majesty still got her swag going on.'

'A red carpet pose if I ever saw one! Love, love the hands in the pockets,' another fan enthused.

The undated photograph was published by Hello! Magazine today and had fans quickly heaping approval (above) and congratulating the British monarch, 93, on her choice of dress

Other social media users were excited to see how happy the Queen appeared to be and suggested this was because of the ever so important pocket detailing.

'The Queen excitedly showing off the fact her dress has pockets is such a mood,' one royal enthusiast wrote.

Another said: 'Even Liz is on my side. Look how thrilled the Queen is to have pockets!'

'The reason the Queen is happy is because she is wearing a dress with pockets,' a second suggested as one person added: 'Even the Queen gets excited about pockets.'

description: The undated photograph was published by Hello! magazine today and had fans quickly heaping praise on the smiling Queen, 93, standing with her hands in the pockets of her cream dress.
